page.title: 15INGROW -southern Keighley
page.content: { Ingrow}is on the southern edge of {Keighley. }The{River Worth}flows past Ingrow on its way to Keighley.In the Worth Valley there is the famous Keighley{Worth Valley Light Railway. It runs on steam from{Oxenhope}to Keighley. Its most famous station is {Damems}which boasts the shortest platform in the world. It also got a prize for being a pretty station. The river valley is steep sided and still has many small woods which go back to ancient times. On the hill tops farms have changed moor-land into dairy farmland.{Friesian cows}and also sheep are seen on the hill-side but the cows are kept indoors on cold winter nights. In winter the cows are fed on{silage and dairy nuts}but in summer their feeding is controlled by electric fences to help the grass to grow properly.
